com.crossover.trial.rest.helpers

Interface WeatherCollectorEndpoint

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WeatherCollectorEndpointImpl

    public interface WeatherCollectorEndpoint
    The interface shared to airport weather collection systems.
    Author:
    code test administartor

    • Method Detail

      • ping

        @GET
 @Path(value="/ping")
javax.ws.rs.core.Response ping()
        A liveliness check for the collection endpoint.
        Returns:
        1 if the endpoint is alive functioning, 0 otherwise

      • updateWeather

        @POST
 @Path(value="/weather/{iata}/{pointType}")
javax.ws.rs.core.Response updateWeather(@PathParam(value="iata")
                                                                                            String iataCode,
                                                                                            @PathParam(value="pointType")
                                                                                            String pointType,
                                                                                            String datapointJson)
        Update the airports atmospheric information for a particular pointType with json formatted data point information.
        Parameters:
        iataCode - the 3 letter airport code
        pointType - the point type, emDataPointType for a complete list
        datapointJson - a json dict containing mean, first, second, thrid and count keys
        Returns:
        HTTP Response code

      • getAirports

        @GET
 @Path(value="/airports")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAirports()
        Return a list of known airports as a json formatted list
        Returns:
        HTTP Response code and a json formatted list of IATA codes

      • getAirport

        @GET
 @Path(value="/airport/{iata}")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAirport(@PathParam(value="iata")
                                                                                                                  String iata)
        Retrieve airport data, including latitude and longitude for a particular airport
        Parameters:
        iata - the 3 letter airport code
        Returns:
        an HTTP Response with a json representation of AirportData

      • addAirport

        @POST
 @Path(value="/airport/{iata}/{lat}/{long}")
javax.ws.rs.core.Response addAirport(@PathParam(value="iata")
                                                                                          String iata,
                                                                                          @PathParam(value="lat")
                                                                                          String latString,
                                                                                          @PathParam(value="long")
                                                                                          String longString)
        Add a new airport to the known airport list.
        Parameters:
        iata - the 3 letter airport code of the new airport
        latString - the airport's latitude in degrees as a string [-90, 90]
        longString - the airport's longitude in degrees as a string [-180, 180]
        Returns:
        HTTP Response code for the add operation

      • addAirport

        @POST
 @Path(value="/airport")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
javax.ws.rs.core.Response addAirport(String airportDataJson)
        Add a new airport to the known airport list.
        Parameters:
        airportDataJson - AirportData string json type
        Returns:
        HTTP Response code for the add operation

      • deleteAirport

        @DELETE
 @Path(value="/airport/{iata}")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteAirport(@PathParam(value="iata")
                                                                                                                        String iata)
        Remove an airport from the known airport list
        Parameters:
        iata - the 3 letter airport code
        Returns:
        HTTP Repsonse code for the delete operation
